Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\) where \\( x(t) \\) and \\( y(t) \\) are real-valued functions governed by the equations \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\), A and B are constant matrices. We explore the effect of a linear transformation \\( h(z) = Cz \\), where C is a constant complex matrix, applied at different times.

If \\( h(z) \\) is applied to a vector \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 and then the system evolves under \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\) without further intervention, will \\( z(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under its respective equations?
Explanation: Applying \\( h(z) \\) modifies the initial condition of the system by a linear transformation. Since C can affect the scaling and rotation in the complex plane, this will certainly lead to a different output at time T, as the evolution trajectories of \\( x(t) \\) and \\( y(t) \\) are scaled or rotated differently.
